source.title: Awake hippocampal sharp-wave ripples support spatial memory

confidence_rationale: Causal SWR disruption in awake task performance supports trajectory-level replay as functionally relevant for memory-guided decisions, consistent with trajectory-first pressure before representational updates.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Interrupting awake hippocampal sharp-wave ripples causes a persistent deficit in spatial alternation performance while sparing place-field coding.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports a MECH-056 style separation where trajectory-level replay/selection dynamics are a primary control substrate, with representational coding alone insufficient for intact decision behavior.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Source is rodent spatial alternation with SWR intervention; transfer to broader REE task families requires boundary validation.
mapping.source_context: Awake rodent hippocampal electrophysiology with closed-loop ripple disruption.

confidence_components.notes: Strong causal manipulation; medium transfer risk outside spatial/hippocampal domains.
